title: Trump’s Waterloo?
content: US President Donald Trump’s second term has been defined by unilateralism, militarism, and lawlessness, pushing constitutional checks and balances to their limits. His intervention in Venezuela could be the point at which his governing style collides with reality, alienating his base and accelerating his political decline.
creator: Harold Hongju Koh
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: What Would a Bardella Presidency Mean For France?
content: National Rally’s Jordan Bardella has emerged as the frontrunner in France’s presidential race, confronting the European Union with the prospect of a far-right Euroskeptic in the Elysée. Yet Bardella appears less intent on dismantling the EU than on exploiting its existing arrangements, which already work to France’s advantage.
creator: Brigitte Granville
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump Has Condemned Europe to Success
content: To survive in a dangerous new world, the European Union, established as an antidote to power politics, must contradict the very principle on which it was founded by becoming a superpower in its own right. Fortunately, it already has all the assets it needs in order to do so.
creator: Sławomir Sierakowski
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Building a Middle-Power World Order
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is right to warn that the old global order has ruptured, and that middle powers must now come together to advance shared interests. They can do so by embracing the principles guiding narrower multilateral arrangements that have proved more effective than many realize.
creator: Anne-Marie Slaughter
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump Wants a “Hot Hot Hot” Economy
content: US President Donald Trump is betting that aggressive fiscal stimulus, deregulation, and looser monetary policy can deliver rapid growth without rekindling inflation. But centuries of experience across dozens of countries suggest that the kind of heterodox experiment now underway in the US rarely ends well in the long run.
creator: Kenneth Rogoff
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Ukraine Is Essential to Europe’s Post-American Defense
content: Given the growing doubts about American security guarantees, Ukraine is now the first and by far most effective line of defense for Europe. It should therefore be recognized as a key element of Europe’s defense perimeter, with access to European funding, technology, networks, and intelligence.
creator: Tatyana Deryugina
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: America’s Year of Self-Destruction
content: The United States owes its superpower status not to pure might, but to the unique combination of material advantages and Enlightenment values. With his reliance on naked power and rejection of all constraints on his authority, Donald Trump represents the opposite of everything that made the country great.
creator: Joschka Fischer
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: American or Chinese Exceptionalism?
content: Both US and Chinese leaders are guilty of personalizing the conflict-prone Sino-American relationship. Continuing down this path – particularly if Donald Trump’s degradation of American leadership becomes a permanent shift, rather than an aberration – raises the important question of which country is truly exceptional.
creator: Stephen S. Roach
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Why Greenland Matters
content: The announcement of a skeletal agreement between US President Donald Trump and NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte was good news, even if it turns out to be a fig leaf for a failed land grab. The brouhaha over Trump’s rhetoric was obscuring what is a genuinely serious geostrategic concern.
creator: Michael Froman
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Israel’s Emergence as an Energy Power Could Become a Liability
content: Although Israel’s recent deal to supply natural gas to Egypt offers many strategic and economic benefits, it also carries serious risks. Without careful planning, future Israeli governments may find themselves forced to choose between honoring export obligations and safeguarding domestic energy security.
creator: Avri Schechter
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: How to Know When You’re an Empire
content: Despite Donald Trump's varying threats against Greenland, the United States has not yet crossed the line into empire, because Greenlandic and Danish consent still matters. Instead, it remains a hegemon that can pressure and persuade without displacing local authority.
creator: Carla Norrlöf
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Why Young People Are Choosing Protest
content: Across much of the world, Gen Z-led protests have become proxies for broader discontent, fueled by deep and persistent governance failures rather than isolated events. These are not episodic flare-ups, but rather expressions of widespread frustration with the yawning gap between policy commitments and implementation.
creator: Rose Ngugi
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: How Developing Countries Can Make the Most of AI
content: Since deploying AI for specific purposes costs a fraction of what it takes to build a new model from scratch, the technology offers developing countries a new opportunity to "leapfrog" to the next stage of industrialization. But success will depend on overcoming three major constraints.
creator: Shamika Sirimanne
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Give Democracy a Chance in Venezuela
content: Instead of trying to restore democracy to Venezuela, US President Donald Trump has teamed up with, in his own words, a "corrupt, criminal, illegitimate regime." But achieving stability and recovering Venezuela's lost prosperity is incompatible with maintaining a dictatorship that destroyed both.
creator: Andrés Velasco
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump’s Biggest Energy Bet Isn’t in Venezuela
content: The US intervention in Venezuela and seizure of its oil may dominate headlines, but a more consequential shift in US energy policy is unfolding off-camera. Unlike the “Donroe Doctrine,” the emerging Pax Silica alliance reflects an understanding that competing with state-led economies requires international cooperation.
creator: Sarah Ladislaw
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Europe’s  Best Tools for Countering Trump
content: European exporters depend more on the US market than American exporters do on Europe, which means the EU is poorly positioned for a tit-for-tat tariff war with the US. But with targeted export tariffs, taxes on royalties, and the elimination of US Treasuries' risk-free status, the EU could hit the US where it hurts.
creator: Daniel Gros
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Fascism by the Book
content: Anyone who thinks that fascism had been vanquished for good in the mid-20th century should look to Minneapolis and other American cities. In Donald Trump's America, and perhaps coming to other countries soon, the panoply of fascism's strategies requires remarkably little updating.
creator: Yanis Varoufakis
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Political Logic of Trump’s Violent Lawlessness
content: The moral horror of ICE and Border Patrol agents executing US citizen observers is enough to denounce the Trump administration’s campaign of cruelty in Minnesota. But it is also important to recognize how it reflects the political logic of turning an entire country into a lawless border zone.
creator: Timothy Snyder
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: MAGA Is Destroying the Culture that Built the West
content: The rise of the West is a simple story to tell culturally: It’s about Europe moving toward openness, cosmopolitanism, intellectual freedom, transparent rules, and, above all, institutional checks and balances. US President Donald Trump negates these values at every turn.
creator: J.P. Singh
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Bloody Minnesota
content: The killings of two innocent civilians – both US citizens – by federal immigration agents in Minneapolis this month may mark a turning point for the United States. The energy and solidarity among people supporting their immigrant neighbors and protesting ICE’s brutal tactics herald a defining showdown.
creator: Daron Acemoglu
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Where Does Europe Go From Here?
content: Beyond showcasing Donald Trump's "neo-royalist" style of politics, this year's annual gathering of the global elite in Davos revealed deeper, structural changes that will shape political and business leaders’ decision-making for years to come. Europeans, in particular, must absorb the right lessons.
creator: Mark Leonard
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Stifling the “Spirit of Dialogue” at Davos
content: The World Economic Forum chose “A Spirit of Dialogue” as the theme for this year’s meeting in Davos. But, to secure US President Donald Trump’s participation, the organization agreed to avoid “woke” topics such as the energy transition, preventing any meaningful exchange on the urgent need for climate action.
creator: Hippolyte Fofack
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump’s War Against the States
content: The killing of two US citizens by federal immigration officers marks a grim turning point in President Donald Trump’s efforts to militarize domestic law enforcement. The events in Minneapolis underscore the dangers of unchecked executive power, as weakened courts and a compliant Congress leave states exposed to federal coercion.
creator: Steven Simon
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump’s American Titanic
content: Donald Trump’s bullying of allies and fallacious arguments have put the US on a collision course with disaster, winning only rare plaudits, notably from the likes of Vladimir Putin. The rest of the world is reorienting itself away from the United States, making an orderly dash for the life rafts that will carry them to dry land together.
creator: Harold James
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Promise of a Middle-Power Alliance
content: In his landmark Davos speech, Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney urged the world’s middle powers to band together, or else risk being dominated by the United States and China. To succeed, they must strengthen trade ties, develop autonomous supply chains, and implement meaningful institutional reforms.
creator: Moreno Bertoldi
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Is Affluence a Barrier to Living Well?
content: In a new book, Brink Lindsey argues that wealthy liberal democracies have essentially solved the problem of material provision and are now experiencing a nervous breakdown. But humans have always struggled with the challenge of living well and wisely.
creator: Michael R. Strain
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page
